channel.title: Did i port forward right? plz read
channel.description:
Here's a link to my router at portforward.com: http://portforward.com/english/routers/port_forwarding/2wire/2701HG-G/Bell_South_Home_Monitoring_System.htm
TCP or UDP: TCP
Port (or range): from 43595 to 43595 ( can't use 43594)
Protocol timeout (seconds): 86400
Map to host port: 43595
Okay, next I went to my firewall and turned it off. After that, i went to exceptions and added one called: TCP Another called: UDP
I made the port 43595 then apply then ok. Did I portforward right?
Thanks

item.title: Did i port forward right? plz read
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

[quote=“tonypker13, post:5, topic:241342”][quote author=usualpker link=topic=317661.msg2520066#msg2520066 date=1225835291]

Read the rules. This will be locked.
[/quote]-.- thanks for the warning… 30 minutes after this was posted…

It’s not my fault I keep up with my school grades.[/quote]

Ever since i stopped coding stuff and messing around with my server i have been doing worse in school…

Yea this will get locked…rule 2 i believe…im not sure.

Read full topic

item.title: Did i port forward right? plz read
item.dc:creator: @Dvs_Chick Dvs Chick
item.description:
@Dvs_Chick wrote:

Just follow the guide. Since I don’t know what type of router you’re using I can’t tell you if you port-forwarded correctly. But usually people use 43594 instead of 43595… I don’t get why you can’t use that.

Read full topic
